ETYMOLOGY: From Late Latin 'biographia', from Ancient Greek 'biographia' (βιογραφία), from 'bios' (βίος 'life') + 'graphia' (γραφία 'writing')

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: An account of someone's life written by someone else.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 由他人撰写的某人一生的记述。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She is currently reading a new biography of Marie Curie.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她目前正在阅读玛丽·居里的一本新传记。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The literary genre consisting of works that recount the lives of individuals.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一种文学体裁，包含记述个人生平的作品。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He enjoys reading all kinds of books, especially biography and history.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他喜欢阅读各种书籍，特别是传记和历史类。
